description.narrative: Sociedad Portuaria Terminal de Contenedores de Buenaventura (the Company) operates a container terminal (the Terminal) in the Port of Buenaventura on Colombias Pacific coast. After several years of rapid growth, the Terminal is reaching its design capacity and is undertaking an expansion to meet growing demand (the Project). The Project is expected to increase the Terminals capacity to 610,000 TEUs and be completed in 2015. The Project will also allow the Terminal to receive the larger vessels expected to be deployed in the future on South American routes. This will be IFCs second financing for the Company, having helped finance its development in August 2010.

The Project will increase Colombia''s competitiveness, and indirectly drive trade growth, by expanding much needed, modern efficient container handling capacity to better serve the country''s exports and imports. The Project will also continue to help reduce the cost of transportation by relieving congestion, improving productivity, and therefore benefitting shippers, shipping lines, and consumers alike. The entrance of TCBuen has led to increased volumes in the port of Buenaventura, as well as improved levels of service for clients from competing terminals. TCBuen project will continue to strengthen Colombia''s port sector by maintaining competition in the market and encourage other terminal operators to continue to improve the efficiency of their own terminal facilities. In addition, the Project will continue creating substantive employment in an area generally devoid of foreign investment and one the poorest in Colombia. This is all expected to result in more fiscal revenues to Colombia.
